summary: This congressional bill, the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026, authorizes appropriations for the Department of Defense for military activities, construction, and defense activities of the Department of Energy. It addresses military personnel strengths, procurement, research and development, operation and maintenance; military personnel policies concerning officers, reserve components, and general service authorities; compensation and benefits; and health care provisions. It also covers acquisition policy, Department of Defense organization and management, and various general provisions related to counterterrorism, studies, reports, and matters relating to foreign nations, specifically including cyber-related matters, and military construction authorization.
